text.p:
THE ASSOCIATION FOR SCOTTISH LITERARY STUDIES
[Beurla]

© Introduction , Commentary , asterisked English translations : Christopher Whyte
© Gaelic text , Dating Letter , Autobiographical Sketch , all remaining English translations : the Estate of Sorley MacLean

Typeset by AFS Image Setters Ltd , Glasgow
Printed and bound in Great Britain by Bell & Bain Ltd , Glasgow

DÀIN DO EIMHIR
Poems to Eimhir

The innocent and the beautiful
Have no enemy but time .
W . B . Yeats

A Somhairle Mac Ghill Eathain Dàin do Eimhir agus Dàin Eile ( Glasgow , William MacLellan 1943 ) 103pp
B Sorley MacLean / Somhairle MacGill - Eain Reothairt is Contraigh [sic] : Taghadh de Dhàin 1932 - 72 / Spring tide and Neap tide : Selected Poems 1932 - 72 ( Edinburgh , Canongate 1977 ) ix + 181 pp
C Somhairle MacGill - Eain / Sorley MacLean O Choille gu Bearradh : Dàin Chruinnichte / From Wood to Ridge :

43 - 44 m May 25th 1941 shows that the order of these two lines was initially reversed

XXX Am Boilseabhach The Bolshevik
